titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Bostock letters, 1802-1822 : to Alexander Marcet
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Paula Jeannet Mangiafico; finding aid derived from MARC record

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via DukeMARC2EAD-HOMproject.xsl October 2014

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: John Bostock letters, to Alexander Marcet
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Letters (ALS) from Bostock to Marcet, 2 letters (ALS) from Marcet to Bostock and other items. The letters touch upon matters personal (e.g. Bostock's move from Liverpool to London) and professional. Includes references to many contemporary European physicians and scientists. Documents the typical research and administrative opportunities available to a British medical practitioner of the early nineteenth century. Acquired as part of the History of Medicine Collections at Duke University.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the John Bostock Letters, 1802-1822 : to Alexander Marcet, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record, October 2014

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters (ALS) from Bostock to Marcet, 2 letters (ALS) from Marcet to Bostock and other items. The letters touch upon matters personal (e.g. Bostock's move from Liverpool to London) and professional. Includes references to many contemporary European physicians and scientists. Documents the typical research and administrative opportunities available to a British medical practitioner of the early nineteenth century. Acquired as part of the History of Medicine Collections at Duke University.
Forms part of the History of Medicine Trent Manuscripts Collection.
